revised_title: Hypothalamic Pathways for Independent Release of Vasopressin and Oxytocin
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on cats to study the release of vasopressin and oxytocin hormones from the hypothalamus. They discovered that the supraoptic nucleus releases vasopressin without oxytocin, while the paraventricular nucleus releases both hormones. This research helps to understand the independent release of these hormones and their functions in the body.
